intro: Cusparia pilocarpoidia, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has adapted to harsh environments through its deep root system and ability to store water in its fleshy leaves. Its flowers typically bloom in late spring or early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Cusparia pilocarpoidia is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
